text: These are the families through which Jesus Christ came. He came through David and Abraham.
speaker: Narrator

text: Abraham was the father of Isaac. Isaac was the father of Jacob. Jacob was the father of Judah and his brothers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Judah was the father of Perez and Zerah. Their mother was Tamar. Perez was the father of Hezron. Hezron was the father of Aram.
speaker: Narrator

text: Aram was the father of Amminadab. Amminadab was the father of Nahshon. Nahshon was the father of Salmon.
speaker: Narrator

text: Salmon was the father of Boaz. The mother of Boaz was Rahab. Boaz was the father of Obed. The mother of Obed was Ruth. Obed was the father of Jesse.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Jesse was the father of David the king.
King David was the father of Solomon. His mother had been the wife of Uriah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Solomon was the father of Rehoboam. Rehoboam was the father of Abijah. Abijah was the father of Asa.
speaker: Narrator

text: Asa was the father of Jehoshaphat. Jehoshaphat was the father of Joram. Joram was the father of Uzziah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Uzziah was the father of Jotham. Jotham was the father of Ahaz. Ahaz was the father of Hezekiah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hezekiah was the father of Manasseh. Manasseh was the father of Amon. Amon was the father of Josiah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Josiah was the father of Jeconiah and his brothers at the time the people were taken to Babylon.
speaker: Narrator

text: After they were taken to the city of Babylon, Jeconiah was the father of Shealtiel. Shealtiel was the father of Zerubbabel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Zerubbabel was the father of Abiud. Abiud was the father of Eliakim. Eliakim was the father of Azor.
speaker: Narrator

text: Azor was the father of Zadok. Zadok was the father of Achim. Achim was the father of Eliud.
speaker: Narrator

text: Eliud was the father of Eleazar. Eleazar was the father of Matthan. Matthan was the father of Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jacob was the father of Joseph. Joseph was the husband of Mary. She was the mother of Jesus Who is called the Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the number of families from Abraham to David was fourteen. The number of families from David to the time the people were taken to Babylon was fourteen. The number of families after they were taken to Babylon to the birth of Jesus Christ was fourteen.
speaker: Narrator

text: The birth of Jesus Christ was like this: Mary His mother had been promised in marriage to Joseph. Before they were married, it was learned that she was to have a baby by the Holy Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joseph was her promised husband. He was a good man and did not want to make it hard for Mary in front of people. He thought it would be good to break the promised marriage without people knowing it.
speaker: Narrator

text: While he was thinking about this, an angel of the Lord came to him in a dream. The angel said, “Joseph, son of David, do not be afraid to take Mary as your wife. She is to become a mother by the Holy Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: A Son will be born to her. You will give Him the name Jesus because He will save His people from the punishment of their sins.”
speaker: Narrator

text: This happened as the Lord said it would happen through the early preacher.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said, “The young woman, who has never had a man, will give birth to a Son. They will give Him the name Immanuel. This means God with us.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Joseph awoke from his sleep. He did what the angel of the Lord told him to do. He took Mary as his wife.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he did not have her, as a husband has a wife, until she gave birth to a Son. Joseph gave Him the name Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus was born in the town of Bethlehem in the country of Judea. It was the time when Herod was king of that part of the country. Soon after Jesus was born, some wise men who learned things from stars came to Jerusalem from the East.
speaker: Narrator

text: They asked, “Where is the King of the Jews Who has been born? We have seen His star in the East. We have come to worship Him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: King Herod heard this. He and all the people of Jerusalem were worried.
speaker: Narrator

text: He called together all the religious leaders of the Jews and the teachers of the Law. Herod asked them where Christ was to be born.
speaker: Narrator

text: They said to him, “In Bethlehem of Judea. The early preacher wrote,
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘You, Bethlehem of Judah, are not the least of the leaders of Judah. Out of you will come a King Who will lead My people the Jews.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Herod had a secret meeting with the men who learned things from stars. He asked them about what time the star had been seen.
speaker: Narrator

text: He sent them to Bethlehem and said, “Go and find the young Child. When you find Him, let me know. Then I can go and worship Him also.”
speaker: Narrator

text: After the king had spoken, they went on their way. The star they had seen in the East went before them. It came and stopped over the place where the young Child was.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they saw the star, they were filled with much joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: They went into the house and found the young Child with Mary, His mother. Then they got down before Him and worshiped Him. They opened their bags of riches and gave Him gifts of gold and perfume and spices.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then God spoke to them in a dream. He told them not to go back to Herod. So they went to their own country by another road.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they had gone, an angel of the Lord came to Joseph in a dream. He said, “Get up. Take the young Child and His mother to the country of Egypt. Go as fast as you can! Stay there until you hear from Me. Herod is going to look for the young Child to kill Him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: During the night he got up and left with the young Child and His mother for Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: He stayed there until Herod died. This happened as the Lord had said through an early preacher, “I called My Son out of Egypt.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Herod learned that the wise men had fooled him. He was very angry. He sent men to kill all the young boys two years old and under in Bethlehem and in all the country near by. He decided to do this from what he had heard from the wise men as to the time when the star was seen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then it happened as the early preacher Jeremiah said it would happen.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said, “The sound of crying and much sorrow was heard in Ramah. Rachel was crying for her children. She would not be comforted because they were dead.”
speaker: Narrator

text: After Herod died, an angel of the Lord came to Joseph in a dream while he was in Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said, “Get up. Take the young Child and His mother and go into the land of the Jews. Those who tried to kill the young Child are dead.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Joseph got up. He took the young Child and His mother and came into the land of the Jews.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joseph heard that Archelaus was the king of the country of Judea. Herod, the father of Archelaus, had died. Joseph was afraid to go there. God told him in a dream to go to the country of Galilee and he went.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joseph stayed in a town called Nazareth. It happened as the early preachers said it would happen. They said, “Jesus will be called a Nazarene.”
speaker: Narrator

text: In those days John the Baptist came preaching in the desert in the country of Judea.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said, “Be sorry for your sins and turn from them! The holy nation of heaven is near.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The early preacher Isaiah spoke of this man. He said, “Listen! His voice calls out in the desert! ‘Make the way ready for the Lord. Make the road straight for Him!’”
speaker: Narrator

text: John wore clothes made of hair from camels. He had a leather belt around him. His food was locusts and wild honey.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the people of Jerusalem and of all the country of Judea and those from near the Jordan River went to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who told of their sins were baptized by him in the Jordan River.
speaker: Narrator

text: He saw many proud religious law-keepers and other people of the religious group who believe no one will be raised from the dead. They were coming to him to be baptized. He said to them, “You family of snakes! Who told you how to keep from God’s anger that is coming?
speaker: Narrator

text: Do something to show me that your hearts are changed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not think you can say to yourselves, ‘We have Abraham as our father.’ For I tell you, God can make children for Abraham out of these stones.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Even now the ax is on the root of the trees. Every tree that does not give good fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: For sure, I baptize with water those who are sorry for their sins and turn from them. The One Who comes after me will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and with fire. He is greater than I. I am not good enough to take off His shoes.
speaker: Narrator

text: He comes ready to clean the grain. He will gather the grain in and clean it all. The clean grain He will put into a building. He will burn that which is no good with a fire that cannot be put out.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus came from Galilee. He went to John at the Jordan River to be baptized by him.
speaker: Narrator

text: John tried to stop Him. He said, “I need to be baptized by You. Do You come to me?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to him, “Let it be done now. We should do what is right.” John agreed and baptized Jesus.
speaker: Jesus

text: When Jesus came up out of the water, the heavens opened. He saw the Spirit of God coming down and resting on Jesus like a dove.
speaker: Narrator

text: A voice was heard from heaven. It said, “This is My much-loved Son. I am very happy with Him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus was led by the Holy Spirit to a desert. There He was tempted by the devil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus went without food for forty days and forty nights. After that He was hungry.
speaker: Narrator

text: The devil came tempting Him and said, “If You are the Son of God, tell these stones to be made into bread.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus said, “It is written, ‘Man is not to live on bread only. Man is to live by every word that God speaks.’”
speaker: Jesus

text: Then the devil took Jesus up to Jerusalem, the holy city. He had Jesus stand on the highest part of the house of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: The devil said to Him, “If You are the Son of God, throw Yourself down. It is written, ‘He has told His angels to look after You. In their hands they will hold You up. Then Your foot will not hit against a stone.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to the devil, “It is written also, ‘You must not tempt the Lord your God.’”
speaker: Jesus

text: Again the devil took Jesus to a very high mountain. He had Jesus look at all the nations of the world to see how great they were.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to Jesus, “I will give You all these nations if You will get down at my feet and worship me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to the devil, “Get away, Satan. It is written, ‘You must worship the Lord your God. You must obey Him only.’”
speaker: Jesus

text: Then the devil went away from Jesus. Angels came and cared for Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus heard that John the Baptist had been put in prison, He went to the country of Galilee.
speaker: Narrator

text: He left Nazareth and went to live in the city of Capernaum. It is by the lake in the land of Zebulun and Naphtali.
speaker: Narrator

text: This happened as the early preacher Isaiah said it would happen. He said,
speaker: Narrator

text: “The land of Zebulun and Naphtali is along the road to the lake. It is on the other side of the Jordan River in Galilee. These people are not Jews.
speaker: Narrator

text: The people who sat in darkness saw a great light. Light did shine on those in the land who were near death.”
speaker: Narrator

text: From that time on, Jesus went about preaching. He said, “Be sorry for your sins and turn from them. The holy nation of heaven is near.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus was walking by the Sea of Galilee. He saw two brothers. They were Simon (his other name was Peter) and Andrew, his brother. They were putting a net into the sea for they were fishermen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to them, “Follow Me. I will make you fish for men!”
speaker: Narrator

text: At once they left their nets and followed Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Going from there, Jesus saw two other brothers. They were James and John, the sons of Zebedee. They were sitting in a boat with their father, mending their nets. Jesus called them.
speaker: Narrator

text: At once they left the boat and their father and followed Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus went over all Galilee. He taught in their places of worship and preached the Good News of the holy nation. He healed all kinds of sickness and disease among the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: The news about Him went over all the country of Syria. They brought all the sick people to Him with many kinds of diseases and pains. They brought to Him those who had demons. They brought those who at times lose the use of their minds. They brought those who could not use their hands and legs. He healed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Many people followed Him from Galilee and Judea. They followed Him from the cities of Decapolis and Jerusalem. They followed Him from Judea and from the other side of the Jordan River.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus saw many people. He went up on the mountain and sat down. His followers came to Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He began to teach them, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Those who know there is nothing good in themselves are happy, because the holy nation of heaven is theirs.
speaker: Jesus

text: Those who have sorrow are happy, because they will be comforted.
speaker: Jesus

text: Those who have no pride in their hearts are happy, because the earth will be given to them.
speaker: Jesus

text: Those who are hungry and thirsty to be right with God are happy, because they will be filled.
speaker: Jesus

text: Those who show loving-kindness are happy, because they will have loving-kindness shown to them.
speaker: Jesus

text: Those who have a pure heart are happy, because they will see God.
speaker: Jesus

text: Those who make peace are happy, because they will be called the sons of God.
speaker: Jesus

text: Those who have it very hard for doing right are happy, because the holy nation of heaven is theirs.
speaker: Jesus

text: You are happy when people act and talk in a bad way to you and make it very hard for you and tell bad things and lies about you because you trust in Me.
speaker: Jesus

text: Be glad and full of joy because your reward will be much in heaven. They made it very hard for the early preachers who lived a long time before you.
speaker: Jesus

text: “You are the salt of the earth. If salt loses its taste, how can it be made to taste like salt again? It is no good. It is thrown away and people walk on it.
speaker: Jesus

text: You are the light of the world. You cannot hide a city that is on a mountain.
speaker: Jesus

text: Men do not light a lamp and put it under a basket. They put it on a table so it gives light to all in the house.
speaker: Jesus

text: Let your light shine in front of men. Then they will see the good things you do and will honor your Father Who is in heaven.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Do not think that I have come to do away with the Law of Moses or the writings of the early preachers. I have not come to do away with them but to complete them.
speaker: Jesus

text: I tell you, as long as heaven and earth last, not one small mark or part of a word will pass away of the Law of Moses until it has all been done.
speaker: Jesus

text: Anyone who breaks even the least of the Law of Moses and teaches people not to do what it says, will be called the least in the holy nation of heaven. He who obeys and teaches others to obey what the Law of Moses says, will be called great in the holy nation of heaven.
speaker: Jesus

text: I tell you, unless you are more right with God than the teachers of the Law and the proud religious law-keepers, you will never get into the holy nation of heaven.
speaker: Jesus

text: “You have heard that men were told long ago, ‘You must not kill another person. If someone does kill, he will be guilty and will be punished for his wrong-doing.’
speaker: Jesus

text: But I tell you that whoever is angry with his brother will be guilty and have to suffer for his wrong-doing. Whoever says to his brother, ‘You have no brains,’ will have to stand in front of the court. Whoever says, ‘You fool,’ will be sent to the fire of hell.
speaker: Jesus

text: If you take your gift to the altar and remember your brother has something against you,
speaker: Jesus

text: leave your gift on the altar. Go and make right what is wrong between you and him. Then come back and give your gift.
speaker: Jesus

text: Agree with the one who is against you while you are talking together, or he might take you to court. The court will hand you over to the police. You will be put in prison.
speaker: Jesus

text: For sure, I tell you, you will not be let out of prison until you have paid every piece of money of the fine.
speaker: Jesus

text: “You have heard that it was said long ago, ‘You must not do sex sins.’
speaker: Jesus

text: But I tell you, anyone who even looks at a woman with a sinful desire of wanting her has already sinned in his heart.
speaker: Jesus

text: If your right eye is the reason you sin, take it out and throw it away. It is better to lose one part of your body than for your whole body to be thrown into hell.
speaker: Jesus

text: If your right hand is the reason you sin, cut it off and throw it away. It is better to lose one part of your body than for your whole body to go to hell.
speaker: Jesus

text: “It has been said, ‘Whoever wants to divorce his wife should have it put in writing, telling her he is leaving her.’
speaker: Jesus

text: But I tell you, whoever divorces his wife except if she has not been faithful to him, makes her guilty of a sex sin. Whoever marries a woman who has been divorced is guilty of a sex sin.
speaker: Jesus

text: “You have heard that it was said long ago, ‘You must not make a promise you cannot keep. You must carry out your promises to the Lord.’
speaker: Jesus

text: I tell you, do not use strong words when you make a promise. Do not promise by heaven. It is the place where God is.
speaker: Jesus

text: Do not promise by earth. It is where He rests His feet. Do not promise by Jerusalem. It is the city of the great King.
speaker: Jesus

text: Do not promise by your head. You are not able to make one hair white or black.
speaker: Jesus

text: Let your yes be YES. Let your no be NO. Anything more than this comes from the devil.
speaker: Jesus

text: “You have heard that it has been said, ‘An eye for an eye and a tooth for a tooth.’
speaker: Jesus

text: But I tell you, do not fight with the man who wants to fight. Whoever hits you on the right side of the face, turn so he can hit the other side also.
speaker: Jesus

text: If any person takes you to court to get your shirt, give him your coat also.
speaker: Jesus

text: Whoever makes you walk a short way, go with him twice as far.
speaker: Jesus

text: Give to any person who asks you for something. Do not say no to the man who wants to use something of yours.
speaker: Jesus

text: “You have heard that it has been said, ‘You must love your neighbor and hate those who hate you.’
speaker: Jesus

text: But I tell you, love those who hate you. (Respect and give thanks for those who say bad things to you. Do good to those who hate you.) Pray for those who do bad things to you and who make it hard for you.
speaker: Jesus

text: Then you may be the sons of your Father Who is in heaven. His sun shines on bad people and on good people. He sends rain on those who are right with God and on those who are not right with God.
speaker: Jesus

text: If you love those who love you, what reward can you expect from that? Do not even the tax-gatherers do that?
speaker: Jesus

text: If you say hello only to the people you like, are you doing any more than others? The people who do not know God do that much.
speaker: Jesus

text: You must be perfect as your Father in heaven is perfect.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Be sure you do not do good things in front of others just to be seen by them. If you do, you have no reward from your Father in heaven.
speaker: Jesus

text: When you give to the poor, do not be as those who pretend to be someone they are not. They blow a horn in the places of worship and in the streets so people may respect them. For sure, I tell you, they have all the reward they are going to get.
speaker: Jesus

text: When you give, do not let your left hand know what your right hand gives.
speaker: Jesus

text: Your giving should be in secret. Then your Father Who sees in secret will reward you.
speaker: Jesus

text: “When you pray, do not be as those who pretend to be someone they are not. They love to stand and pray in the places of worship or in the streets so people can see them. For sure, I tell you, they have all the reward they are going to get.
speaker: Jesus

text: When you pray, go into a room by yourself. After you have shut the door, pray to your Father Who is in secret. Then your Father Who sees in secret will reward you.
speaker: Jesus

text: When you pray, do not say the same thing over and over again making long prayers like the people who do not know God. They think they are heard because their prayers are long.
speaker: Jesus

text: Do not be like them. Your Father knows what you need before you ask Him.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Pray like this: ‘Our Father in heaven, Your name is holy.
speaker: Jesus

text: May Your holy nation come. What You want done, may it be done on earth as it is in heaven.
speaker: Jesus

text: Give us the bread we need today.
speaker: Jesus

text: Forgive us our sins as we forgive those who sin against us.
speaker: Jesus

text: ‘Do not let us be tempted, but keep us from sin. Your nation is holy. You have power and shining-greatness forever. Let it be so.’
speaker: Jesus

text: “If you forgive people their sins, your Father in heaven will forgive your sins also.
speaker: Jesus

text: If you do not forgive people their sins, your Father will not forgive your sins.
speaker: Jesus

text: “When you go without food so you can pray better, do not be as those who pretend to be someone they are not. They make themselves look sad so people will see they are going with out food. For sure, I tell you, they have all the reward they are going to get.
speaker: Jesus

text: When you go without food so you can pray better, put oil on your head and wash your face.
speaker: Jesus

text: Then nobody knows you are going without food. Then your Father Who sees in secret will reward you.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Do not gather together for yourself riches of this earth. They will be eaten by bugs and become rusted. Men can break in and steal them.
speaker: Jesus

text: Gather together riches in heaven where they will not be eaten by bugs or become rusted. Men cannot break in and steal them.
speaker: Jesus

text: For wherever your riches are, your heart will be there also.
speaker: Jesus

text: The eye is the light of the body. If your eye is good, your whole body will be full of light.
speaker: Jesus

text: If your eye is bad, your whole body will be dark. If the light in you is dark, how dark it will be!
speaker: Jesus

text: No one can have two bosses. He will hate the one and love the other. Or he will listen to the one and work against the other. You cannot have both God and riches as your boss at the same time.
speaker: Jesus

text: “I tell you this: Do not worry about your life. Do not worry about what you are going to eat and drink. Do not worry about what you are going to wear. Is not life more important than food? Is not the body more important than clothes?
speaker: Jesus

text: Look at the birds in the sky. They do not plant seeds. They do not gather grain. They do not put grain into a building to keep. Yet your Father in heaven feeds them! Are you not more important than the birds?
speaker: Jesus

text: Which of you can make himself a little taller by worrying?
speaker: Jesus

text: Why should you worry about clothes? Think how the flowers grow. They do not work or make cloth.
speaker: Jesus

text: But I tell you that Solomon in all his greatness was not dressed as well as one of these flowers.
speaker: Jesus

text: God clothes the grass of the field. It lives today and is burned in the stove tomorrow. How much more will He give you clothes? You have so little faith!
speaker: Jesus

text: Do not worry. Do not keep saying, ‘What will we eat?’ or, ‘What will we drink?’ or, ‘What will we wear?’
speaker: Jesus

text: The people who do not know God are looking for all these things. Your Father in heaven knows you need all these things.
speaker: Jesus

text: First of all, look for the holy nation of God. Be right with Him. All these other things will be given to you also.
speaker: Jesus

text: Do not worry about tomorrow. Tomorrow will have its own worries. The troubles we have in a day are enough for one day.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Do not say what is wrong in other people’s lives. Then other people will not say what is wrong in your life.
speaker: Jesus

text: You will be guilty of the same things you find in others. When you say what is wrong in others, your words will be used to say what is wrong in you.
speaker: Jesus

text: Why do you look at the small piece of wood in your brother’s eye, and do not see the big piece of wood in your own eye?
speaker: Jesus

text: How can you say to your brother, ‘Let me take that small piece of wood out of your eye,’ when there is a big piece of wood in your own eye?
speaker: Jesus

text: You who pretend to be someone you are not, first take the big piece of wood out of your own eye. Then you can see better to take the small piece of wood out of your brother’s eye.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Do not give that which belongs to God to dogs. Do not throw your pearls in front of pigs. They will break them under their feet. Then they will turn and tear you to pieces.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Ask, and what you are asking for will be given to you. Look, and what you are looking for you will find. Knock, and the door you are knocking on will be opened to you.
speaker: Jesus

text: Everyone who asks receives what he asks for. Everyone who looks finds what he is looking for. Everyone who knocks has the door opened to him.
speaker: Jesus

text: What man among you would give his son a stone if he should ask for bread?
speaker: Jesus

text: Or if he asks for a fish, would he give him a snake?
speaker: Jesus

text: You are bad and you know how to give good things to your children. How much more will your Father in heaven give good things to those who ask Him?
speaker: Jesus

text: “Do for other people whatever you would like to have them do for you. This is what the Jewish Law and the early preachers said.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Go in through the narrow door. The door is wide and the road is easy that leads to hell. Many people are going through that door.
speaker: Jesus

text: But the door is narrow and the road is hard that leads to life that lasts forever. Few people are finding it.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Watch out for false teachers. They come to you dressed as if they were sheep. On the inside they are hungry wolves.
speaker: Jesus

text: You will know them by their fruit. Do men pick grapes from thorns? Do men pick figs from thistles?
speaker: Jesus

text: It is true, every good tree has good fruit. Every bad tree has bad fruit.
speaker: Jesus

text: A good tree cannot have bad fruit. A bad tree cannot have good fruit.
speaker: Jesus

text: Every tree that does not have good fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire.
speaker: Jesus

text: So you will know them by their fruit.
speaker: Jesus

text: Not everyone who says to me, ‘Lord, Lord,’ will go into the holy nation of heaven. The one who does the things My Father in heaven wants him to do will go into the holy nation of heaven.
speaker: Jesus

text: Many people will say to Me on that day, ‘Lord, Lord, did we not preach in Your Name? Did we not put out demons in Your Name? Did we not do many powerful works in Your Name?’
speaker: Jesus

text: Then I will say to them in plain words, ‘I never knew you. Go away from Me, you who do wrong!’
speaker: Jesus

text: “Whoever hears these words of Mine and does them, will be like a wise man who built his house on rock.
speaker: Jesus

text: The rain came down. The water came up. The wind blew and hit the house. The house did not fall because it was built on rock.
speaker: Jesus

text: Whoever hears these words of Mine and does not do them, will be like a foolish man who built his house on sand.
speaker: Jesus

text: The rain came down. The water came up. The wind blew and hit the house. The house fell and broke apart.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Then Jesus finished talking. The people were surprised and wondered about His teaching.
speaker: Narrator

text: He was teaching them as One Who has the right and the power to teach. He did not teach as the teachers of the Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus came down from the mountain. Many people followed Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: A man with a bad skin disease came and got down before Him and worshiped Him. He said, “Lord, if You will, You can heal me!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus put His hand on him and said, “I will. You are healed!” At once the man was healed.
speaker: Jesus

text: Jesus said to him, “Go now, but tell no one. Let the religious leader see you. Give the gift in worship that Moses told you to give. This will show them you have been healed.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Jesus came to the city of Capernaum. A captain of the army came to Him. He asked for help,
speaker: Narrator

text: saying, “Lord, my servant is sick in bed. He is not able to move his body. He is in much pain.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to the captain, “I will come and heal him.”
speaker: Jesus

text: The captain said, “Lord, I am not good enough for You to come to my house. Only speak the word, and my servant will be healed.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am a man who works for someone else and I have men working under me. I say to this man, ‘Go!’ and he goes. I say to another, ‘Come!’ and he comes. I say to my servant, ‘Do this!’ and he does it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus heard this, He was surprised and wondered about it. He said to those who followed Him, “For sure, I tell you, I have not found so much faith in the Jewish nation.
speaker: Jesus

text: I say to you, many people will come from the east and from the west. They will sit down with Abraham and with Isaac and with Jacob in the holy nation of heaven.
speaker: Jesus

text: But those who should have belonged to the holy nation of heaven will be thrown out into outer darkness, where there will be crying and grinding of teeth.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Jesus said to the captain, “Go your way. It is done for you even as you had faith to believe.” The servant was healed at that time.
speaker: Jesus

text: Jesus came to Peter’s house. He saw Peter’s wife’s mother in bed. She was very sick.
speaker: Narrator

text: He touched her hand and the sickness left her. She got up and cared for Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: That evening they brought to Jesus many people who had demons in them. The demons were put out when Jesus spoke to them. All the sick people were healed.
speaker: Narrator

text: It happened as the early preacher Isaiah said it would happen. He said, “He took on Himself our sickness and carried away our diseases.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus saw many people and told them to go to the other side of the lake.
speaker: Narrator

text: A teacher of the Law came to Jesus. He said, “Lord, I will follow You wherever You go.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to him, “Foxes have holes. Birds have nests. But the Son of Man has no place to lay His head.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Another of His followers said to Him, “Lord, let me go first and bury my father.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to him, “Follow Me. Let the people who are dead bury their own dead.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Jesus got into a boat. His followers followed Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: At once a bad storm came over the lake. The waves were covering the boat. Jesus was sleeping.
speaker: Narrator

text: His followers went to Him and called, “Help us, Lord, or we will die!”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to them, “Why are you afraid? You have so little faith!” Then He stood up. He spoke sharp words to the wind and the waves. Then the wind stopped blowing.
speaker: Jesus

text: Then men were surprised and wondered about it. They said, “What kind of a man is He? Even the winds and the waves obey Him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus came to the other side of the lake into the country of the Gadarenes. Two men came to Him from among the graves. They had demons in them and were very wild men. They were so bad that no one would go near them.
speaker: Narrator

text: They called out, saying, “What do You want of us, You Son of God? Have You come here to make us suffer before it is our time to suffer?”
speaker: Narrator

text: A long way from there many pigs were eating.
speaker: Narrator

text: The demons begged Jesus, saying, “If You put us out, send us into the pigs.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to the demons, “Go!” They came out of the men and went into the pigs. At once the pigs ran down the mountain side. They fell into the water and died.
speaker: Narrator

text: The men who cared for the pigs ran fast into the city and told everything. They told what happened to the men who had the demons.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every person in the city came to meet Jesus. When they saw Jesus, they asked Him to leave their country.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus got into a boat. He crossed over to the other side and came into His own city.
speaker: Narrator

text: They took a man to Him who was on his bed. This man was not able to move his body. Jesus saw their faith. He said, “Son, take hope. Your sins are forgiven.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Some of the teachers of the Law said to themselves, “This man speaks as if He is God, but He is not!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus knew what they were thinking. He said, “Why do you think bad thoughts in your hearts?
speaker: Jesus

text: Which is easier to say, ‘Your sins are forgiven,’ or to say, ‘Get up and walk?’
speaker: Jesus

text: But this is to show you that the Son of Man has power on earth to forgive sins.” He said to the sick man, “Get up! Take your bed and go home.”
speaker: Jesus

text: He got up and went to his home.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the people saw this. They were surprised and wondered about it. Then they gave thanks to God because He had given such power to men.
speaker: Narrator

text: As Jesus went from there, He saw a man called Matthew. Matthew was sitting at his work gathering taxes. Jesus said to him, “Follow Me.” Matthew got up and followed Jesus.
speaker: Jesus

text: Jesus ate in Matthew’s house. Many men who gathered taxes and many who were sinners came to Matthew’s house and sat down with Jesus and His followers.
speaker: Narrator

text: The proud religious law-keepers saw this. They said to the followers of Jesus, “Why does your Teacher eat with men who gather taxes and with sinners?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus heard them and said, “People who are well do not need a doctor.
speaker: Jesus

text: But go and understand these words, ‘I want loving-kindness and not a gift to be given.’ For I have not come to call good people. I have come to call those who are sinners.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Then the followers of John the Baptist came to Jesus. They asked, “Why do we and the proud religious law-keepers many times go without food so we can pray better? But Your followers never go without food so they can pray better.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said, “Can the friends at a wedding be sorry when the man just married is with them? But the days will come when the man just married will be taken from them. Then they will not eat food so they can pray better.
speaker: Jesus

text: “No one sews a piece of new cloth on an old coat, because if the new piece pulls away, it makes the hole bigger.
speaker: Narrator

text: Men do not put new wine into old skin bags. If they did, the skins would break and the wine would run out. The bags would be no good. They put new wine into new skin bags and both can be used.”
speaker: Jesus

text: While Jesus talked to them, a leader of the people came and got down before Him, and worshiped Him. He said, “My daughter has just died. But come, lay Your hand on her and she will live.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus got up and followed him. His followers went also.
speaker: Narrator

text: Just then a woman who had been sick with a flow of blood for twelve years came from behind. She touched the bottom of His coat.
speaker: Narrator

text: She said to herself, “If I only touch the bottom of His coat, I will be healed.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus turned around. He saw her and said, “Daughter, take hope! Your faith has healed you.” At once the woman was healed.
speaker: Jesus

text: Jesus came into the leader’s house. He saw the people playing music and making much noise.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to them, “Go now! For the girl is not dead, but is sleeping.” But they laughed at Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He sent the people outside. Then He went in and took the girl’s hand. She was raised up.
speaker: Narrator

text: News of this went out into all the country.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus went on from there. Two blind men followed Him. They called out, “Take pity on us, Son of David.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus went into the house. The blind men came to Him. Then Jesus said to them, “Do you have faith that I can do this?” They said to Him, “Yes, Sir!”
speaker: Jesus

text: Then Jesus put His hands on their eyes and said, “You will have what you want because you have faith.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Their eyes were opened. Jesus told them to tell no one.
speaker: Jesus

text: But when they had gone, they told about Him everywhere in the country.
speaker: Narrator

text: As they went on their way, a man who had a demon and could not talk was brought to Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the demon was put out of him, the man was able to talk. Many people were surprised and wondered about it. They said, “We have never seen in the nation of the Jews like this.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But the proud religious law-keepers said, “He puts out demons by the help of the leader of the demons.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus went on to all the towns and cities. He taught in their places of worship. He preached the Good News of the holy nation of God. He healed every sickness and disease the people had.
speaker: Narrator

text: As He saw many people, He had loving-pity on them. They were troubled and were walking around everywhere. They were like sheep without a shepherd.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then He said to His followers, “There is much grain ready to gather. But the workmen are few.
speaker: Jesus

text: Pray then to the Lord Who is the Owner of the grain fields that He will send workmen to gather His grain.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Jesus called His twelve followers to Him. He gave them power to put out demons and to heal all kinds of sickness and disease.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the names of the twelve followers. There were Simon who was called Peter, and Andrew his brother, and James and John who were the sons of Zebedee.
speaker: Narrator

text: There were Philip and Bartholomew and Thomas. There was Matthew, the man who gathered taxes. There were James the son of Alphaeus, and Thaddeaus, and
speaker: Narrator

text: Simon the Canaanite. There was Judas Iscariot who handed Jesus over to be killed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus sent out these twelve followers. He told them to go, saying, “Stay away from people who are not Jews. And do not go to any town in the country of Samaria.
speaker: Jesus

text: But go to the Jewish people who are lost.
speaker: Jesus

text: As you go, preach. Say, ‘The holy nation of heaven is near.’
speaker: Jesus

text: Heal the sick and those with bad skin diseases. Raise the dead. Put out demons. You have received much, now give much.
speaker: Jesus

text: Do not take gold or silver or brass money with you.
speaker: Jesus

text: Do not take a bag of things for the trip. Do not take two coats or shoes or a walking stick. A workman should receive his food and what he needs.
speaker: Jesus

text: “When you come to a city or town, find a home that is respected and stay there until you leave.
speaker: Jesus

text: As you go into a house, tell them you hope good comes to them.
speaker: Jesus

text: And if the house is respected, give them your good wishes. If it is not respected, let your good wishes come back to you.
speaker: Jesus

text: Whoever does not receive you or does not listen to what you say, as you leave that house or city, shake off the dust from your feet.
speaker: Jesus

text: For sure, I tell you, it will be easier for the land of Sodom and Gomorrah on the day men stand before God and are told they are guilty, than for that city.
speaker: Jesus

text: “I am sending you out like sheep with wolves all around you. Be wise like snakes and gentle like doves.
speaker: Jesus

text: But look out for men. They will take you up to their courts and they will hurt you in their places of worship.
speaker: Jesus

text: They will take you in front of the leaders of the people and of the kings because of Me. You will tell them and the people who do not know God about Me.
speaker: Jesus

text: When you are put into their hands, do not worry what you will say or how you will say it. The words will be given you when the time comes.
speaker: Jesus

text: It will not be you who will speak the words. The Spirit of your Father will speak through you.
speaker: Jesus

text: “A brother will hand over a brother to be put to death. A father will hand over his child to be put to death. Children will hand over their parents to be put to death.
speaker: Jesus

text: You will be hated by all people because of Me. But he who stays true to the end will be saved.
speaker: Jesus

text: When they make it hard for you in one town, go to another. For sure, I tell you, before you have gone through the Jewish cities, the Son of Man will come.
speaker: Jesus

text: “A follower is not greater than his teacher. A servant who is owned by someone is not greater than his owner.
speaker: Jesus

text: A follower should be happy to be as his teacher, and a servant who is owned by someone should be happy to be as his owner. If they have called the head of the house Satan, how much more will they speak against those of the house.
speaker: Jesus

text: Then do not be afraid of them. For nothing is covered up that will not be brought out into the light. There is nothing hid that will not be made known.
speaker: Jesus

text: You tell in the light what I tell you in the dark. You must speak with a loud voice from the roofs of houses what you have heard.
speaker: Jesus

text: Do not be afraid of them who kill the body. They are not able to kill the soul. But fear Him Who is able to destroy both soul and body in hell.
speaker: Jesus

text: Are not two small birds sold for a very small piece of money? And yet not one of the birds falls to the earth without your Father knowing it.
speaker: Jesus

text: God knows how many hairs you have on your head.
speaker: Jesus

text: So do not be afraid. You are more important than many small birds.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Whoever makes Me known in front of men, I will make him known to My Father in heaven.
speaker: Jesus

text: But whoever does not make Me known in front of men and acts as if he does not know Me, I will not make him known to My Father in heaven.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Do not think I came to bring peace on the earth. I did not come to bring peace, but a sword.
speaker: Jesus

text: I came to turn a man against his father. I came to turn a daughter against her mother. I came to turn a daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law.
speaker: Jesus

text: A man will be hated by his own family.
speaker: Jesus

text: “He who loves his father and mother more than Me is not good enough for Me. He who loves son or daughter more than Me is not good enough for Me.
speaker: Jesus

text: He who does not take his cross and follow Me is not good enough for Me.
speaker: Jesus

text: He who wants to keep his life will have it taken away from him. He who loses his life because of Me will have it given back to him.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Whoever receives you, receives Me. Whoever receives Me, receives Him Who sent Me.
speaker: Jesus

text: Whoever receives a preacher who speaks for God because he is a preacher, will get the reward of a preacher who speaks for God. Whoever receives a man right with God, because he is a man right with God, will get the reward of a man right with God.
speaker: Jesus

text: For sure, I tell you, anyone who gives a cup of cold water to one of these little ones because he follows Me, will not lose his reward.”
speaker: Jesus

text: When Jesus finished telling His twelve followers what to do, He went away from there to teach and preach in their towns.
speaker: Narrator

text: When John the Baptist was in prison, he heard what Jesus was doing. He sent his followers.
speaker: Narrator

text: They asked, “Are You the One Who was to come, or should we look for another?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to them, “Go and tell John what you see and hear.
speaker: Narrator

text: The blind are made to see. Those who could not walk are walking. Those who have had bad skin diseases are healed. Those who could not hear are hearing. The dead are raised up to life and the Good News is preached to poor people.
speaker: Narrator

text: He is happy who is not ashamed of Me and does not turn away because of Me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: As the followers of John the Baptist went away, Jesus began to tell the people about John. He said, “What did you go out to see in the desert? A small tree shaking in the wind?
speaker: Narrator

text: But what did you go out to see? A man dressed in good clothes? Those who are dressed in good clothes are in the houses of kings.
speaker: Narrator

text: What did you go out to see? One who speaks for God? Yes, I tell you, he is more than one who speaks for God.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the man the Holy Writings spoke of when they said, ‘See! I will send My helper to carry news ahead of You. He will make Your way ready for You!’
speaker: Narrator

text: For sure, I tell you, of those born of women, there is no one greater than John the Baptist. The least in the holy nation of heaven is greater than he.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the days of John the Baptist until now, the holy nation of heaven has suffered very much. Fighting men try to take it.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the early preachers and the Law told about it until the time of John.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if you will believe it, he is Elijah who was to come.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have ears, then listen!
speaker: Narrator

text: “What are the people of this day like? They are like children playing in the center of town where people gather. They call to their friends.
speaker: Narrator

text: They say, ‘We played music for you, but you did not dance. We showed sorrow in front of you, but you did not show sorrow.’
speaker: Narrator

text: John came and did not eat or drink. They said, ‘He has a demon.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Son of Man came and ate and drank. They said, ‘See! He eats too much and likes wine. He is a friend of men who gather taxes and of sinners!’ But wisdom shows itself to be right by what it does.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then He began to say strong words against the cities where most of His powerful works were done. He spoke to them because they were not sorry for their sins and did not turn from them.
speaker: Narrator

text: “It is bad for you, city of Chorazin! It is bad for you, town of Bethsaida! For if the powerful works which were done in you had been done in the cities of Tyre and Sidon, they would have turned from their sins long ago. They would have shown their sorrow by putting on clothes made from hair and would have sat in ashes.
speaker: Narrator

text: I tell you, it will be better for Tyre and Sidon on the day men stand before God and are told they are guilty, than for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “And Capernaum, are you to be lifted up into heaven? You will be taken down to hell. If the powerful works which were done in you had been done in the city of Sodom, it would be here to this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I say to you that it will be better for the land of Sodom on the day men stand before God and are told they are guilty, than for you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: At that time Jesus said, “Thank You, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, because You hid these things from the wise and from those who have much learning. You have shown them to little children.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yes, Father, it was good in Your sight.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Everything has been given to Me by My Father. No one knows the Son but the Father. No one knows the Father but the Son, and those to whom the Son wants to make the Father known.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Come to Me, all of you who work and have heavy loads. I will give you rest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Follow My teachings and learn from Me. I am gentle and do not have pride. You will have rest for your souls.
speaker: Narrator

text: For My way of carrying a load is easy and My load is not heavy.”
speaker: Narrator

text: At that time Jesus walked through the grain-fields on the Day of Rest. His followers were hungry and began to pick off grain to eat.
speaker: Narrator

text: The proud religious law-keepers saw this. They said to Jesus, “See! Your followers do what the Law says not to do on the Day of Rest.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to them, “Have you not read what David did when he and his men were hungry?
speaker: Narrator

text: He went into the house of God and ate the special bread used in worship which was against the Law for him or those with him to eat! Only the Jewish religious leaders were to eat that special bread.
speaker: Narrator

text: Have you not read in the Law how the religious leaders do that which is not right to do on the Day of Rest, and yet they are not guilty?
speaker: Narrator

text: I tell you that Someone greater than the house of God is here.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you had understood what the words mean, ‘I want loving-kindness and not a gift to be given,’ you would not say a person is guilty who has done no wrong.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Son of Man is Lord of the Day of Rest.”
speaker: Narrator

text: From there Jesus went into their place of worship.
speaker: Narrator

text: A man was there with a dried-up hand. The proud religious law-keepers asked Jesus, “Does the Law say it is right to heal on the Day of Rest?” They wanted something to say against Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to them, “If one of you has a sheep which falls into a hole on the Day of Rest, will you not take hold of it and pull it out?
speaker: Narrator

text: How much better is a man than a sheep! So it is right to do good on the Day of Rest.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then He said to the man, “Put out your hand.” He held it out and it was made as well as the other.
speaker: Narrator

text: The proud religious law-keepers went out and made plans against Him. They planned how they might kill Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus knew this and went away from there. Many people followed Him and He healed all of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: He told them to tell no one of Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: It happened as the early preacher Isaiah said it would happen, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “See! My Servant Whom I have chosen! My much Loved, in Whom My soul is well pleased! I will put My Spirit in Him. He will say to the nations what is right from wrong.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will not fight or speak with a loud voice. No man will hear His voice in the streets.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will not break a broken branch. He will not put out a little fire until He makes things right.
speaker: Narrator

text: In His name the nations will have hope.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they brought to Him a man who had a demon. He was blind and could not speak. Jesus healed him and he could talk and see.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the people were surprised and said, “Can this Man be the Son of David?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the proud religious law-keepers heard it, they said, “This Man puts out demons only by Satan, the leader of demons.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus knew their thoughts and said to them, “Every nation divided into groups that fight each other is going to be destroyed. Every city or family divided into groups that fight each other will not stand.
speaker: Narrator

text: If the devil puts out the devil, he is divided against himself. How will his nation stand?
speaker: Narrator

text: If I put out demons by Satan, by whom do your followers put them out? So your followers will say if you are guilty.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if I put out demons by the Spirit of God, then the holy nation of God is come to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: How can anyone go into a strong man’s house and take away his things, unless he ties up the strong man first? Only then can he take things from his house.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Whoever is not with Me is against Me. Whoever is not gathering with Me is sending everywhere.
speaker: Narrator

text: I tell you, every sin and every bad word men speak against God will be forgiven, but bad words spoken against the Holy Spirit will not be forgiven.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever speaks a word against the Son of Man will be forgiven, but whoever speaks against the Holy Spirit will not be forgiven in this life or in the life to come.
speaker: Narrator

text: “A good tree gives good fruit. A bad tree gives bad fruit. A tree is known by its fruit.
speaker: Narrator

text: You family of snakes! How can you say good things when you are sinful? The mouth speaks what the heart is full of.
speaker: Narrator

text: A good man will speak good things because of the good in him. A bad man will speak bad things because of the sin in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: I say to you, on the day men stand before God, they will have to give an answer for every word they have spoken that was not important.
speaker: Narrator

text: For it is by your words that you will not be guilty and it is by your words that you will be guilty.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then some of the teachers of the Law and the proud religious law-keepers said to Jesus, “Teacher, we would like to have you do something special for us to see.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to them, “The sinful people of this day look for something special to see. There will be nothing special to see but the powerful works of the early preacher Jonah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jonah was three days and three nights in the stomach of a big fish. The Son of Man will be three days and three nights in the grave also.
speaker: Narrator

text: The men of the city of Nineveh will stand up with the people of this day on the day men stand before God. Those men will say these people are guilty because the men of Nineveh were sorry for their sins and turned from them when Jonah preached. And see, Someone greater than Jonah is here!
speaker: Narrator

text: “The queen of the south will stand up with the people of this day on the day men stand before God. She will say that these people are guilty because she came from the ends of the earth to listen to the wise sayings of Solomon. And see, Someone greater than Solomon is here!
speaker: Narrator

text: “When a demon is gone out of a man, it goes through dry places to find rest. It finds none.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then it says, ‘I will go back into my house from which I came.’ When it goes back, it sees that it is empty. But it sees that the house has been cleaned and looks good.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then it goes out and comes back bringing with it seven demons more sinful than itself. They go in and live there. In the end that man is worse than at first. It will be like this with the sinful people of this day.”
speaker: Narrator

text: While Jesus was still talking to the people, His mother and His brothers came and stood outside. They wanted to talk to Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Someone said to Him, “Your mother and brothers are outside and want to talk to you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said, “Who is My mother? And who are My brothers?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He put out His hand to His followers and said, “See, these are My mother and My brothers!
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever does what My father in heaven wants him to do is My brother and My sister and My mother.”
speaker: Narrator

text: That same day Jesus went out of the house and sat down by the shore of the lake.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then He got in a boat and sat down because so many people had gathered around Him. Many people were standing on the shore.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus taught them many things by using picture-stories. He said, “A man went out to plant seeds.
speaker: Narrator

text: As he planted the seeds, some fell by the side of the road. The birds came and ate the seeds.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some seeds fell between rocks. The seeds came up at once because there was so little ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the sun was high in the sky, they dried up and died because they had no root.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some seeds fell among thorns. The thorns grew and did not give the seeds room to grow.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some seeds fell on good ground and gave much grain. Some gave one hundred times as much grain. Some gave sixty times as much grain. Some gave thirty times as much grain.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have ears, then listen.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The followers of Jesus came to Him and said, “Why do You speak to them in picture-stories?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to the followers, “You were given the secrets about the holy nation of heaven. The secrets were not given to the others.
speaker: Narrator

text: He who has will have more given to him. He will have even more than enough. But he who has little will have even that taken away from him.
speaker: Narrator

text: “This is why I speak to them in picture-stories. They have eyes but they do not see. They have ears but they do not hear and they do not understand.
speaker: Narrator

text: It happened in their lives as Isaiah said it would happen. He said, ‘You hear and hear but do not understand. You look and look but do not see.
speaker: Narrator

text: The hearts of these people have become fat. They hear very little with their ears. They have closed their eyes. If they did not do this, they would see with their eyes and hear with their ears and understand with their hearts. Then they would be changed in their ways, and I would heal them.’
speaker: Narrator

text: But how great are your eyes because they see. How great are your ears because they hear.
speaker: Narrator

text: For sure, I tell you, that many early preachers and men right with God have wanted to see the things you see, but they did not see them. They wanted to hear the things you hear, but they did not hear them.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Listen to the picture-story of the man who planted seeds in the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: When anyone hears the Word about the holy nation and does not understand it, the devil comes and takes away what was put in his heart. He is like the seed that fell by the side of the road.
speaker: Narrator

text: The seed which fell between rocks is like the person who receives the Word with joy as soon as he hears it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Its root is not deep and it does not last long. When troubles and suffering come because of the Word, he gives up and falls away.
speaker: Narrator

text: The seed which fell among thorns is like the person who hears the Word but the cares of this life, and the love for money let the thorns come up and do not give the seed room to grow and give grain.
speaker: Narrator

text: The seed which fell on good ground is like the one who hears the Word and understands it. He gives much grain. Some seed gives one hundred times as much grain. Some gives sixty times as much grain. Some gives thirty times as much grain.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus told them another picture-story. He said, “The holy nation of heaven is like a man who planted good seed in his field.
speaker: Narrator

text: During the night someone who hated him came and planted weed seed with the good seed in his field and went away.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the good seed started to grow and give grain, weeds came up also.
speaker: Narrator

text: “The servants of the man who planted the seed came and said to him, ‘Sir, did you not plant good seed in your field? Why does it have weeds also?’
speaker: Narrator

text: The man who planted the seed said, ‘Someone who hates me has done this.’ The servants asked him, ‘Should we go and pull the weeds out from among the good grain?’
speaker: Narrator

text: He said, ‘No, because if you pull out the weeds, the good grain will come up also.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them grow together until the time to gather the grain. Then I will say to the workmen, “Gather the weeds first and put them together to be burned. Then gather the good grain into my building.”’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus told them another picture-story. He said, “The holy nation of heaven is like mustard seed which a man planted in his field.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is the smallest of seeds. But when it is full-grown, it is larger than the grain of the fields and it becomes a tree. The birds of the sky come and stay in its branches.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus gave them another picture-story. He said, “The holy nation of heaven is like yeast that a woman put into three pails of flour until it had become much more than at first.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus told all these things using picture-stories to the many people. He did not speak to them without using picture-stories.
speaker: Narrator

text: It happened as the early preacher said it would happen, “I will open My mouth in picture-stories. I will tell things which have been kept secret from the beginning of the world.”
speaker: Narrator

text: After Jesus sent the people away, He went into the house. His followers came to Him and said, “Tell us what You mean by the picture-story of the weeds in the field.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said, “He Who plants the good seed is the Son of Man.
speaker: Narrator

text: The field is the world. The good seeds are the children of the holy nation. The weeds are the children of the devil.
speaker: Narrator

text: The devil is the one who got in and planted the weeds. The time to gather is the end of the world. The men who gather are the angels.
speaker: Narrator

text: As the weeds are gathered together and burned in the fire, so will it be in the end of the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Son of Man will send His angels. They will gather out of His holy nation all things that cause people to sin and those who do sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will put them into a stove of fire. There will be loud crying and grinding of teeth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the ones right with God will shine as the sun in the holy nation of their Father. You have ears, then listen!”
speaker: Narrator

text: “The holy nation of heaven is like a box of riches buried in a field. A man found it and then hid it again. In his joy he goes and sells all that he has and buys that field.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Again, the holy nation of heaven is like a man who buys and sells. He is looking for good pearls.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he finds one good pearl worth much money, he goes and sells all that he has and buys it.
speaker: Narrator

text: “The holy nation of heaven is like a big net which was let down into the sea. It gathered fish of every kind.
speaker: Narrator

text: When it was full, they took it to the shore. They sat down and put the good fish into pails. They threw the bad fish away.
speaker: Narrator

text: It will be like this in the end of the world. Angels will come and take the sinful people from among those who are right with God.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will put the sinful people into a stove of fire where there will be loud crying and grinding of teeth.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus asked them, “Have you understood all these picture-stories?” They said, “Yes, Lord!”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to them, “Every teacher of the Law who has become a follower of the holy nation of heaven is like a man who owns his house. He takes new and old riches from his house.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus had finished these picture-stories, He went away from there.
speaker: Narrator

text: He came to His own town and taught them in their places of worship. They were surprised and wondered, saying, “Where did this Man get this wisdom? How can He do these powerful works?
speaker: Narrator

text: Is not this the son of the man who makes things from wood? Is not Mary His mother? Are not James and Joseph and Simon and Judas His brothers?
speaker: Narrator

text: And are not all His sisters here? Then where did He get all these things?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they were ashamed of Him and turned away because of Him. Jesus said to them, “One who speaks for God is shown no respect in his own town and in his own house.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He did not do many powerful works there because they did not put their trust in Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: At that time King Herod heard much about Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to his helpers, “This must be John the Baptist. He has risen from the dead. That is why these powerful works are done by him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: For Herod had taken John and put him in prison. It was because of Herodias, the wife of his brother Philip.
speaker: Narrator

text: For John had said to him, “It is against the Law for you to have her.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He would have killed John but he was afraid of the people. The people thought John was one who spoke for God.
speaker: Narrator

text: On Herod’s birthday the daughter of Herodias danced in front of them. Herod was made happy by her.
speaker: Narrator

text: He promised he would give her anything she asked.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because her mother told her to do it, she said, “Give me the head of John the Baptist on a plate.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The king was sorry. But he said for it to be given because he had promised and because of those who were eating with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He sent to the prison and had John’s head cut off.
speaker: Narrator

text: It was brought in on a plate and given to the girl. She brought it to her mother.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the followers of John came and took his body and buried it. They went and told Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus heard that John had been killed, He went from there by boat to a desert. He wanted to be alone. When the people knew it, they followed after Him by land from the cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: When He got out of the boat, He saw many people. He had loving-pity for them and healed those who were sick.
speaker: Narrator

text: When it was evening, His followers came to Him. They said, “This is a desert. The day is past. Send the people away so they may go into the towns and buy food for themselves.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to them, “They do not have to go away. Give them something to eat.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They said to Him, “We have only five loaves of bread and two fish.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said, “Bring them to Me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He told the people to sit down on the grass. Then He took the five loaves of bread and two fish. He looked up to heaven and gave thanks. He broke the loaves in pieces and gave them to His followers. The followers gave them to the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: They all ate and were filled. They picked up twelve baskets full of pieces of bread and fish after the people were finished eating.
speaker: Narrator

text: About five thousand men ate. Women and children ate also.
speaker: Narrator

text: At once Jesus had His followers get into the boat. He told them to go ahead of Him to the other side while He sent the people away.
speaker: Narrator

text: After He had sent them away, He went up the mountain by Himself to pray. When evening came, He was there alone.
speaker: Narrator

text: By this time the boat was far from land and was being thrown around by the waves. The wind was strong against them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Just before the light of day, Jesus went to them walking on the water.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the followers saw Him walking on the water, they were afraid. They said, “It is a spirit.” They cried out with fear.
speaker: Narrator

text: At once Jesus spoke to them and said, “Take hope. It is I. Do not be afraid!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter said to Jesus, “If it is You, Lord, tell me to come to You on the water.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said, “Come!” Peter got out of the boat and walked on the water to Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when he saw the strong wind, he was afraid. He began to go down in the water. He cried out, “Lord, save me!”
speaker: Narrator

text: At once Jesus put out His hand and took hold of him. Jesus said to Peter, “You have so little faith! Why did you doubt?”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus and Peter got into the boat, the wind stopped blowing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those in the boat worshiped Jesus. They said, “For sure, You are the Son of God!”
speaker: Narrator

text: When they had gone over to the other side, they came to the land of Gennesaret.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the men of that land saw it was Jesus, they sent word into all the country around. They brought all who were sick to Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: They begged Him that they might touch the bottom of His coat. As many as touched the bottom of His coat were healed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some of the teachers of the Law and the proud religious law-keepers from Jerusalem came to Jesus. They asked,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Why do Your followers not obey the teaching that was given to them by our fathers? They do not wash their hands before they eat.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to them, “Why do you break the Law of God by trying to keep their teaching?
speaker: Narrator

text: For God said, ‘Show respect to your father and mother.’ And, ‘He who curses his father or mother will be put to death.’
speaker: Narrator

text: But you say that if a man says to his parents that anything he has, that might have been of help to them, is already given to God,
speaker: Narrator

text: he does not have to show respect by helping his father and mother. You are putting aside the Word of God to keep their teaching.
speaker: Narrator

text: You who pretend to be someone you are not, Isaiah told about you. He said,
speaker: Narrator

text: ’These people show respect to Me with their mouth, but their heart is far from Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their worship of Me is worth nothing. They teach what men have made up.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus called the people to Him and said to them, “Listen and understand this!
speaker: Narrator

text: It is not what goes into a man’s mouth that makes his mind and heart sinful. It is what comes out of a man’s mouth that makes him sinful.”
speaker: Narrator

text: His followers came to Him. They said, “Did You know the proud religious law-keepers were ashamed and turned away because of You when they heard this?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said, “Every plant that My Father in heaven did not plant will be pulled up by the roots.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them alone. They are blind leaders of the blind. If one blind man leads another blind man, they will both fall into a hole.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Peter said to Jesus, “Tell us this picture-story so we can understand it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said, “Do you not understand yet?
speaker: Narrator

text: Do you not understand that whatever goes into the mouth goes into the stomach and then out of the body?
speaker: Narrator

text: But whatever comes from the mouth has come out of the heart. These things make the man unclean inside.
speaker: Narrator

text: For out of the heart come bad thoughts, killing other people, sex sins of a married person, sex sins of a person not married, stealing, lying, speaking against God.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the things that make the man unclean inside. It does not make a man sinful to eat with hands that have not been washed.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus went from there to the cities of Tyre and Sidon.
speaker: Narrator

text: A woman came from the land of Canaan. She cried out to Jesus and said, “Take pity on me, Lord, Son of David! My daughter has a demon and is much troubled.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus did not speak a word to her. His followers kept asking, saying, “Send her away for she keeps calling us.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said, “I was sent only to the Jewish people who are lost.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then she came and got down before Jesus and worshiped Him. She said, “Lord, help me!”
speaker: Narrator

text: But He said, “It is not right to take children’s food and throw it to the dogs.”
speaker: Narrator

text: She said, “Yes, Lord, but even the dogs eat the pieces that fall from the table of their owners.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to her, “Woman, you have much faith. You will have what you asked for.” Her daughter was healed at that very time.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus went from there and came to the Sea of Galilee. Then He went up the mountain and sat down.
speaker: Narrator

text: Many people came to Him. They brought with them those who were not able to walk. They brought those who were not able to see. They brought those who were not able to hear or speak and many others. Then they put them at the feet of Jesus and He healed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the people wondered. They saw how those who could not speak were now talking. They saw how those who could not walk were now walking. They saw how those who could not see were now seeing, and they gave thanks to the God of the Jews.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus called His followers to Him. He said, “I pity these people because they have been with Me three days and they have no food. I do not want to send them home without food. They might get too weak as they go.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The followers said to Jesus, “Where can we get enough bread to feed them all in this desert?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to them, “How many loaves of bread do you have?” They said, “Seven loaves and a few small fish.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He told the people to sit down on the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then He took the seven loaves of bread and the fish and gave thanks. He broke them and gave them to His followers. The followers gave them to the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: They all ate and were filled. They picked up seven baskets full of pieces of bread and fish after the people finished eating.
speaker: Narrator

text: Four thousand men ate. Women and children ate also.
speaker: Narrator

text: After this Jesus sent the people away. Then He got into a boat and came to a place called Magadan.
speaker: Narrator

text: The proud religious law-keepers and a religious group of people who believe no one will be raised from the dead came to Jesus. They asked Him to show something special from heaven. They wanted to trap Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: (He said to them, “In the evening you say, ‘The weather will be good tomorrow because the sky is red.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And in the morning you say, ‘We will have a storm today because the sky is red and the clouds are low.’ You understand the things you see in the sky, but you cannot understand the special things you see these days!)
speaker: Narrator

text: The sinful people of this day go after something special to see. There will be nothing special for them to see but the early preacher Jonah.” Then He went away from them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The followers came to the other side of the lake. They remembered they had forgotten to bring bread.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to them, “See! Have nothing to do with the yeast of the proud religious law-keepers and the religious group of people who believe no one will be raised from the dead.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They started to think about it among themselves and said, “He said this because we forgot to bring bread.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus knew this and said, “You have very little faith! Why are you talking among yourselves about not bringing bread?
speaker: Narrator

text: Do you not yet understand or remember the five loaves of bread that fed five thousand men? And how many baskets full were gathered up?
speaker: Narrator

text: Or do you not even remember the seven loaves of bread that fed the four thousand men? And how many baskets full were gathered up?
speaker: Narrator

text: Why is it that you do not see that I was not talking to you about bread? I was talking to you about keeping away from the yeast of the proud religious law-keepers and the religious group of people who believe no one will be raised from the dead.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they understood that it was not the yeast of bread that He was talking about. But He was talking about the teaching of the proud religious law-keepers and of the other religious group of people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus came into the country of Caesarea Philippi. He asked His followers, “Who do people say that I, the Son of Man, am?”
speaker: Narrator

text: They said, “Some say You are John the Baptist and some say Elijah and others say Jeremiah or one of the early preachers.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to them, “But who do you say that I am?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Simon Peter said, “You are the Christ, the Son of the living God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to him, “Simon, son of Jonah, you are happy because you did not learn this from man. My Father in heaven has shown you this.
speaker: Narrator

text: “And I tell you that you are Peter. On this rock I will build My church. The powers of hell will not be able to have power over My church.
speaker: Narrator
